  685: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c::"},
  686: 	 {{0,0,0,16#c440,16#55c0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  687: 	  "::c440:55c0:c66c:77:88"},
  688: 	 {{16#c11,0,0,0,16#55c0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  689: 	  "c11::55c0:c66c:77:88"},
  690: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  691: 	  "c11:c22::c66c:77:88"},
  692: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,0,0,0,16#77,16#88},
  693: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::77:88"},
  694: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,0,0,0,16#88},
  695: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440::88"},
  696: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,16#55c0,0,0,0},
  697: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440:55c0::"},
  698: 	 {{0,0,0,0,16#55c0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  699: 	  "::55c0:c66c:77:88"},
  700: 	 {{16#c11,0,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  701: 	  "c11::c66c:77:88"},
  702: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,0,16#77,16#88},
  703: 	  "c11:c22::77:88"},
  704: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,0,0,0,0,16#88},
  705: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::88"},
  706: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,0,0,0,0},
  707: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440::"},
  708: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  709: 	  "::c66c:77:88"},
  710: 	 {{16#c11,0,0,0,0,0,16#77,16#88},
  711: 	  "c11::77:88"},
  712: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,0,0,16#88},
  713: 	  "c11:c22::88"},
  714: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,0,0,0,0,0},
  715: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::"},
  716: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,65535,258,65534},"::ffff:1.2.255.254"},
  717:          {{16#fe80,12345,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%012345"},
  718: 	 {{16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff},
  719: 	  "ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff"}
  720:          |[{list_to_tuple(P++[(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4]),
  721:             Q++S}
  722:            || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <-
  723:                   tl(V4Reversable),
  724:               {P,Q} <-
  725:                   [{[0,0,0,0,0,16#ffff],"::ffff:"},
  726:                    {[0,0,0,0,0,0],"::"}]]],
  727:     V4Sloppy =
  728: 	[{{10,1,16#98,16#76},"10.0x019876"},
  729: 	 {{8#12,1,8#130,8#321},"012.01.054321"},
  730: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.253.254.0377"},
  731: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"0Xfc.000000000375.0x0000fe.255"},
  732: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.253.65279"},
  733: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.0xFD.0177377"},
  734: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.16645887"},
  735: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"00374.0XFDFEFF"},
  736: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"4244504319"},
  737: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"0xfcfdfeff"},
  738: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"00000000000037477377377"},
  739: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12345678"},
  740: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0x345678"},
  741: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x5678"},
  742: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x56.0X78"},
  743: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0"},
  744: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00"},
  745: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0"},
  746: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00.00.00"},
  747: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.00.0.0"},
  748: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0.000000000000.0"}],
  749:     V6Sloppy =
  750:         [{{16#a,16#b,16#c,16#0,16#0,16#d,16#e,16#f},"A:B:C::d:e:f"},
  751:          {{16#fe80,0,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%XXXXXXX"}]
  752:         ++
  753:         [{{P,0,0,0,0,D2,(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4},
  754:           Q++erlang:integer_to_list(D2, 16)++":"++S}
  755:          || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <- V4Reversable,
  756:             {P,Q} <-
  757:                 [{16#2001,"2001::"},{16#177,"177::"},{16#ff0,"Ff0::"}]],
  758:     V4Err =
  759: 	["0.256.0.1",
  760: 	 "1.2.3.4.5",
  761: 	 "256.255.65535",
  762: 	 "4294967296",
  763: 	 "0x100000000",
  764: 	 "040000000000",
  765: 	 "1.2.3.-4",
  766: 	 "1.2.-3.4",
  767: 	 "1.-2.3.4",
  768: 	 "-1.2.3.4",
  769: 	 "10.",
  770: 	 "172.16.",
  771: 	 "198.168.0.",
  772: 	 "127.0.0.1."],
  773:     V6Err =
  774: 	[":::",
  775: 	 "f:::2",
  776: 	 "::-1",
  777: 	 "::g",
  778: 	 "f:f11::10100:2",
  779: 	 "f:f11::01100:2",
  780: 	 "::17000",
  781: 	 "::01700",
  782: 	 "10000::",
  783: 	 "01000::",
  784: 	 "::8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1",
  785: 	 "8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1::",
  786: 	 "8:7:6:5:4::3:2:1",
  787: 	 "::1.2.3.4.5",
  788: 	 "::1.2.3.04",
  789: 	 "::1.256.3.4",
  790: 	 "::-5.4.3.2",
  791: 	 "::5.-4.3.2",
  792: 	 "::5.4.-3.2",
  793: 	 "::5.4.3.-2",
  794: 	 "::FFFF:1.2.3.4.5",
  795: 	 "::10.",
  796: 	 "::FFFF:172.16.",
  797: 	 "fe80::198.168.0.",
  798: 	 "fec0::fFfF:127.0.0.1."],
  799:     t_parse_address
  800:       (parse_ipv6_address,
  801:        false,
  802:        V6Reversable++V6Sloppy++V6Err++V4Err),
  803:     t_parse_address
  804:       (parse_ipv6strict_address,
  805:        true,
  806:        V6Reversable++V6Err++V4Err),
  807:     t_parse_address
  808:       (parse_ipv4_address,
  809:        false,
  810:        V4Reversable++V4Sloppy++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V6Reversable]),
  811:     t_parse_address
  812:       (parse_ipv4strict_address,
  813:        true,
  814:        V4Reversable++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V4Sloppy++V6Reversable]).
  815: 
  816: t_parse_address(Func, _Reversable, []) ->
  817:     io:format("~p done.~n", [Func]),
  818:     ok;
  819: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [{Addr,String}|L]) ->
  820:     io:format("~p = ~p.~n", [Addr,String]),
  821:     {ok,Addr} = inet:Func(String),
  822:     case Reversible of
  823:         true ->String = inet:ntoa(Addr);
  824:         false -> ok
  825:     end,
  826:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L);
  827: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [String|L]) ->
  828:     io:format("~p.~n", [String]),
  829:     {error,einval} = inet:Func(String),
  830:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L).
  831: 
  832: parse_strict_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  833:     {ok, {127,0,0,1}} =
  834: 	inet:parse_strict_address("127.0.0.1"),
  835:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,21952,50796,119,136}} =
  836: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c:77:0088"),
  837:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,0,0,119,136}} =
  838: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440::077:0088").
  839: 
  840: is_ip_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  841:     IPv4Addresses = [
  842:         {0, 0, 0, 0},
  843:         {255, 255, 255, 255}
  844:     ],
  845:     IPv6Addresses = [
  846:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  847:         {16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff}
  848:     ],
  849:     NonIPAddresses = [
  850:         foo,
  851:         "0.0.0.0",
  852:         {},
  853:         {0},
  854:         {0, 0},
  855:         {0, 0, 0},
  856:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  857:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  858:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  859:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  860:         {0, 0, 0, foo},
  861:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, foo},
  862:         {0, 0, 0, 256},
  863:         {0, 0, 256, 0},
  864:         {0, 256, 0, 0},
  865:         {256, 0, 0, 0},
  866:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000},
  867:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0},
  868:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0},
  869:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0},
  870:         {0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  871:         {0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  872:         {0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  873:         {16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  874:         {0, 0, 0, -1},
  875:         {0, 0, -1, 0},
  876:         {0, -1, 0, 0},
  877:         {-1, 0, 0, 0},
  878:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1},
  879:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0},
  880:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0},
  881:         {0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0},
  882:         {0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  883:         {0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  884:         {0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  885:         {-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}
  886:     ],
  887: 
  888:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv4Addresses),
  889:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  890: 
  891:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv6Addresses),
  892:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv4Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  893: 
  894:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ IPv4Addresses),
  895:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, NonIPAddresses).
  896: 
  897: ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  898:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} = IPv4Address =
  899:         {rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  900:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  901:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  902:          rand:uniform(256) - 1},
  903:     E7 = (D1 bsl 8) bor D2,
  904:     E8 = (D3 bsl 8) bor D4,
  905:     io:format("IPv4Address: ~p.~n", [IPv4Address]),
  906:     {0,0,0,0,0,65535,E7,E8} = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv4Address),
  907:     IPv6Address =
  908:         {rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  909:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  910:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  911:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  912:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  913:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1, E7, E8},
  914:     IPv4Address = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv6Address),
  915:     ok.
  916: 
  917: 
  918: ntoa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  919:     M8 = 1 bsl 8,
  920:     M16 = 1 bsl 16,
  921:     V4Xs = rand_tuple(4, M8),
  922:     V6Xs = rand_tuple(4, M16),
  923:     ntoa(
  924:       [{A, B, C, D} ||
  925:           A <- [0, element(1, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  926:           B <- [0, element(2, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  927:           C <- [0, element(3, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  928:           D <- [0, element(4, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256]], M8-1),
  929:     ntoa(
  930:       [{E, F, G, H, G, G, E, F} ||
  931:           E <- [0, element(1, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  932:           F <- [0, element(2, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  933:           G <- [0, element(3, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  934:           H <- [0, element(4, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16]], M16-1).
  935: 
  936: ntoa([A | As], Max) ->
  937:     case
  938:         lists:all(
  939:           fun (X) when 0 =< X, X =< Max -> true;
  940:               (_) -> false
  941:           end, tuple_to_list(A))
  942:     of
  943:         true ->
  944:             S = inet:ntoa(A),
  945:             {ok, A} = inet:parse_address(S);
  946:         false ->
  947:             {error, einval} = inet:ntoa(A)
  948:     end,
  949:     ntoa(As, Max);
  950: ntoa([], _Max) ->
  951:     ok.
  952: 
  953: rand_tuple(N, M) ->
  954:     rand_tuple(N, M, []).
  955: %%
  956: rand_tuple(0, _M, Acc) ->
  957:     list_to_tuple(Acc);
  958: rand_tuple(N, M, Acc) ->
  959:     rand_tuple(N - 1, M, [rand:uniform(M) - 1 | Acc]).
  960: 
  961: 
  962: t_gethostnative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  963:     %% this will result in 26 bytes sent which causes problem in Windows
  964:     %% if the port-program has not assured stdin to be read in BINARY mode
  965:     %% OTP-2555
  966:     case inet_gethost_native:gethostbyname(
  967: 	   "a23456789012345678901234") of
  968: 	{error,notfound} ->
  969: 	    ok;
  970: 	{error,no_data} ->
  971: 	    ok;
  972: 	{error,try_again} ->
  973: 	    ok
  974:     end.
  975: 
  976: %% Check that the emulator survives crashes in gethost_native.
  977: gethostnative_parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  978:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
  979:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
  980:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
  981: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  982: 	    do_gethostnative_parallell();
  983: 	_ ->
  984: 	    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
  985:     end.
  986: 
  987: do_gethostnative_parallell() ->
  988:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  989:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, parallell_gethost, []),
  990:     receive after 10000 -> ok end,
  991:     pong = net_adm:ping(Node),
  992:     peer:stop(Peer),
  993:     ok.
  994: 
  995: parallell_gethost() ->
  996:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
  997:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  998:     parallell_gethost_loop(10, Hostname).
  999: 
 1000: parallell_gethost_loop(0, _) -> ok;
 1001: parallell_gethost_loop(N, Hostname) ->
 1002:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1003: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1004: 	    true = exit(Pid,kill);
 1005: 	_ ->
 1006: 	    ok
 1007:     end,
 1008: 
 1009:     L = spawn_gethosters(Hostname, 10),
 1010:     release_gethosters(L),
 1011:     collect_gethosters(10),
 1012:     parallell_gethost_loop(N-1, Hostname).
 1013: 
 1014: spawn_gethosters(_, 0) ->
 1015:     [];
 1016: spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N) ->
 1017:     Collector = self(),
 1018:     [spawn(fun() ->
 1019: 		   receive 
 1020: 		       go ->
 1021: 			   case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1022: 			       {ok,_} ->
 1023: 				   Collector ! ok;
 1024: 			       Else ->
 1025: 				   Collector ! {error,Else}
 1026: 			   end
 1027: 		   end 
 1028: 	   end) | 
 1029:      spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N-1)].
 1030: 
 1031: release_gethosters([]) ->
 1032:     ok;
 1033: release_gethosters([H|T]) ->
 1034:     H ! go,
 1035:     release_gethosters(T).
 1036: 
 1037: collect_gethosters(0) ->
 1038:     ok;
 1039: collect_gethosters(N) ->
 1040:     receive
 1041: 	ok ->
 1042: 	    collect_gethosters(N-1);
 1043: 	Else ->
 1044: 	    {failed, {unexpected, Else}}
 1045:     after 2000 ->
 1046: 	    {failed, {missing, N}}
 1047:     end.
 1048: 
 1049: kill_gethost() ->
 1050:     kill_gethost(20).
 1051: 
 1052: kill_gethost(0) ->
 1053:     ok;
 1054: kill_gethost(N) ->
 1055:     put(kill_gethost_n,N),
 1056:     Pid = wait_for_gethost(10),
 1057:     true = exit(Pid,kill),
 1058:     wait_for_dead_gethost(10),
 1059:     kill_gethost(N-1).
 1060: 
 1061: wait_for_dead_gethost(0) ->
 1062:     exit({not_dead,inet_gethost_native});
 1063: wait_for_dead_gethost(N) ->
 1064:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1065: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1066: 	    receive after 1000 ->
 1067: 			    ok
 1068: 		    end,
 1069: 	    wait_for_dead_gethost(N-1);
 1070: 	undefined ->
 1071: 	    ok
 1072:     end.
 1073: 
 1074: wait_for_gethost(0) ->
 1075:     exit(gethost_not_found);
 1076: wait_for_gethost(N) ->
 1077:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1078:     case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1079: 	{ok,_} ->
 1080: 	    ok;
 1081: 	Otherwise ->
 1082: 	    %% This is what I call an exit tuple :)
 1083: 	    exit({inet,gethostbyname, returned, Otherwise, 'when',
 1084: 		  'N','=',N,'and','hostname','=',Hostname,'and',
 1085: 		  kill_gethost_n,'=',get(kill_gethost_n)})
 1086:     end,
 1087:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1088: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1089: 	    Pid;
 1090: 	_ ->
 1091: 	    receive
 1092: 	    after 1000 ->
 1093: 		    ok
 1094: 	    end,
 1095: 	    wait_for_gethost(N-1)
 1096:     end.
 1097: 
 1098: %% Check that the resolver handles a CNAME loop.
 1099: cname_loop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1100:     %% getbyname (hostent_by_domain)
 1101:     ok = inet_db:add_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, ttl, "mydomain.com"),
 1102:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:getbyname("mydomain.com", ?S_A),
 1103:     ok = inet_db:del_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, "mydomain.com"),
 1104:     %% res_hostent_by_domain
 1105:     RR = #dns_rr{domain = "mydomain.com",
 1106: 		 class = in,
 1107: 		 type = ?S_CNAME,
 1108: 		 data = "mydomain.com"},
 1109:     Rec = #dns_rec{anlist = [RR]},
 1110:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:res_hostent_by_domain("mydomain.com", ?S_A, Rec),
 1111:     ok.
 1112: 
 1113: 
 1114: %% Test that hosts file gets reloaded correctly in case when it
 1115: % was missing during initial startup
 1116: missing_hosts_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1117:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1118:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ ".hosts"),
 1119:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "inetrc"),
 1120:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1121:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(HostsFile),
 1122:     % start a node
 1123:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1124:     % ensure it has our RC
 1125:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1126:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1127:     % ensure it does not resolve
 1128:     {error, nxdomain} = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1129:     % write hosts file
 1130:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, "1.2.3.4 somehost"),
 1131:     % wait for cached timestamp to expire
 1132:     timer:sleep(?RES_FILE_UPDATE_TM * 1000 + 100),
 1133:     % ensure it DOES resolve
 1134:     {ok,{hostent,"somehost",[],inet,4,[{1,2,3,4}]}} =
 1135:         rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1136:     % cleanup
 1137:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1138: 
 1139: 
 1140: %% The /etc/hosts file format and limitations is quite undocumented.
 1141: %%
 1142: %% Our implementation of the hosts file resolver tries to
 1143: %% do the right thing.  Here is an attempt to define "the right thing",
 1144: %% and this test case tries to check most of these rules:
 1145: %%
 1146: %% * A hosts file consists of entries with one IP address,
 1147: %%   and a list of host names.  The IP address is IPv4 or IPv6.
 1148: %%   The first host name is the primary host name
 1149: %%   and the others are aliases.
 1150: %%
 1151: %% * A lookup for an IP address should return one #hostent{} record
 1152: %%   with the one IP address from the query, and the host names
 1153: %%   from all entries with the same IP address concatenated.
 1154: %%   The first host name from the first hosts file entry
 1155: %%   with the requested IP address will be the primary host name
 1156: %%   and all others are aliases.  All host names are returned
 1157: %%   as in the hosts file entries i.e character case is preserved.
 1158: %%
 1159: %% * A lookup for a host name is character case insensitive.
 1160: %%
 1161: %% * A lookup for a host name should return one #hostent{} record
 1162: %%   with the host name list from the first hosts file entry
 1163: %%   with an IP address of the requested address family
 1164: %%   that has a matching host name, as it is in the hosts file
 1165: %%   i.e character case is preserved.  The IP addresses in the
 1166: %%   returned #hostent{} record should be the first from the
 1167: %%   same matching hosts file entry, followed by all others
 1168: %%   for which there is a matching host name and address family.
 1169: %%   There should be no duplicates among the returned IP addresses.
 1170: %%
 1171: %% * These rules are of the opinion that if duplicate host names
 1172: %%   with the same character casing occurs for the same IP
 1173: %%   address, it is a configuration error, so it is not tested for
 1174: %%   and there is no preferred behaviour.
 1175: hosts_file_quirks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1176:     Records = [R1, R2, R3, R4, R5] =
 1177:         [#hostent{
 1178:             h_name = h_ex(Name),
 1179:             h_aliases = [h_ex(Alias) || Alias <- Aliases],
 1180:             h_addrtype = Fam,
 1181:             h_length =
 1182:                 case Fam of
 1183:                     inet -> 4;
 1184:                     inet6 -> 16
 1185:                 end,
 1186:             h_addr_list =
 1187:                 [case Fam of
 1188:                      inet -> inet_ex(N);
 1189:                      inet6 -> inet6_ex(N)
 1190:                  end]}
 1191:          || {{Fam,N}, Name, Aliases} <-
 1192:                 [{{inet,1}, "a", ["B"]},
 1193:                  {{inet,2}, "D", []},
 1194:                  {{inet6,3}, "A", ["c"]},
 1195:                  {{inet,1}, "c", []},
 1196:                  {{inet,5}, "A", []}]],
 1197:     true = R1#hostent.h_addr_list =:= R4#hostent.h_addr_list,
 1198:     R14 =
 1199:         R1#hostent{
 1200:           h_aliases =
 1201:               R1#hostent.h_aliases ++
 1202:               [R4#hostent.h_name | R4#hostent.h_aliases]},
 1203:     R145 =
 1204:         R14#hostent{
 1205:           h_addr_list =
 1206:               R1#hostent.h_addr_list ++ R5#hostent.h_addr_list},
 1207:     %%
 1208:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1209:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-quirks.hosts"),
 1210:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "quirks.inetrc"),
 1211:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, hostents_to_list(Records)),
 1212:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1213:     %%
 1214:     %% start a node
 1215:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1216:     %% ensure it has our RC
 1217:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1218:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1219:     false = lists:keyfind(host, 1, Rc),
 1220:     %%
 1221:     %% check entries
 1222:     io:format("Check hosts file contents~n", []),
 1223:     V1 =
 1224:       [{R14, inet_ex(1)},
 1225:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1226:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1227:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1228:        {R145, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1229:        {R14, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1230:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1231:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1232:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1233:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1234:       ],
 1235:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1236:     %%
 1237:     %% test add and del
 1238:     A1 = inet_ex(1),
 1239:     Hs1 = [h_ex("a"), h_ex("B")],
 1240:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, add_host, [A1, Hs1]),
 1241:     io:format("Check after add host~n", []),
 1242:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(
 1243:       TestNode,
 1244:       [{R1, A1},
 1245:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1246:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1247:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1248:        {R1, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1249:        {R1, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1250:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1251:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1252:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1253:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1254:       ]),
 1255:     {host, A1, Hs1} =
 1256:         lists:keyfind(host, 1, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, [])),
 1257:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, del_host, [inet_ex(1)]),
 1258:     io:format("Check after del host~n", []),
 1259:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1260:     %%
 1261:     %% cleanup
 1262:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1263: 
 1264: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs) ->
 1265:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs, true).
 1266: %%
 1267: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, [], Ok) ->
 1268:     case Ok of
 1269:         true -> ok;
 1270:         false -> error(verify_failed)
 1271:     end;
 1272: hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, [V | Vs], Ok) ->
 1273:     case
 1274:         case V of
 1275:             {R, Addr} ->
 1276:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyaddr, [Addr])};
 1277:             {R, Host, Fam} ->
 1278:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, [Host, Fam])}
 1279:         end
 1280:     of
 1281:         {nxdomain, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1282:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1283:         {_R_1, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1284:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: nxdomain~n", [V]),
 1285:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false);
 1286:         {R_1, {ok, R_1}} ->
 1287:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1288:         {_R_1, {ok, R_2}} ->
 1289:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: ~p~n", [V, R_2]),
 1290:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false)
 1291:     end.
 1292: 
 1293: %% Expand entry
 1294: h_ex(H) -> H ++ ".example.com".
 1295: inet_ex(N) -> {127,17,17,N}.
 1296: inet6_ex(N) -> {0,0,0,0,17,17,17,N}.
 1297: 
 1298: hostents_to_list([]) -> [];
 1299: hostents_to_list([R | Rs]) ->
 1300:     #hostent{
 1301:        h_name = Name,
 1302:        h_aliases = Aliases,
 1303:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = R,
 1304:     [inet:ntoa(IP), $\t,
 1305:      lists:join($\s, [Name | Aliases]), $\r, $\n
 1306:      | hostents_to_list(Rs)].
 1307: 
 1308: 
 1309: %% These must be run in the whole suite since they need
 1310: %% the host list and require inet_gethost_native to be started.
 1311: %%
 1312: -record(gethostnative_control, {control_seq,
 1313: 				control_interval = 100,
 1314: 				lookup_delay     = 10,
 1315: 				lookup_count     = 300,
 1316: 				lookup_processes = 20}).
 1317: 
 1318: gethostnative_soft_restart() -> required(hosts).
 1319: 
 1320: %% Check that no name lookups fails during soft restart
 1321: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1322: gethostnative_soft_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1323:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1324:                                         [soft_restart]),
 1325:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1326: 
 1327: gethostnative_debug_level() -> required(hosts).
 1328: 
 1329: %% Check that no name lookups fails during debug level change
 1330: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1331: gethostnative_debug_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1332:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1333:                                         [{debug_level, 1},
 1334:                                          {debug_level, 0}]),
 1335:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1336: 
 1337: gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config, CtrlSeq) ->
 1338:     Factor = ?config(kernel_factor, Config),
 1339:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(Factor, CtrlSeq).
 1340: 
 1341: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(1, CtrlSeq) ->
 1342:     #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq};
 1343: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(F, CtrlSeq) ->
 1344:     Opts = #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq},
 1345:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(F, Opts).
 1346: 
 1347: gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(
 1348:   F,
 1349:   #gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1350:                          lookup_processes = NProc} = Opts) ->
 1351:     Adjust = fun(X) ->
 1352:                      if
 1353:                          F > 10 ->
 1354:                              X div 4;
 1355:                          F > 5 ->
 1356:                              X div 3;
 1357:                          F > 2 -> 
 1358:                              (2 * X) div 3;
 1359:                          true ->
 1360:                              X
 1361:                      end
 1362:              end,
 1363:     Opts#gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Adjust(Cnt),
 1364:                                lookup_processes = Adjust(NProc)}.
 1365: 
 1366: 
 1367: gethostnative_control(Config, Opts) ->
 1368:     case inet_db:res_option(lookup) of
 1369: 	[native] ->
 1370: 	    case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1371: 		Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1372: 		    gethostnative_control_1(Config, Opts);
 1373: 		_ ->
 1374: 		    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1375: 	    end;
 1376: 	_ ->
 1377: 	    {skipped, "Native not only lookup method"}
 1378:     end.
 1379: 
 1380: gethostnative_control_1(
 1381:   Config,
 1382:   #gethostnative_control{control_seq      = Seq,
 1383:                          control_interval = Interval,
 1384:                          lookup_delay     = Delay,
 1385:                          lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1386:                          lookup_processes = N}) ->
 1387:     ?P("gethostnative control -> begin with"
 1388:        "~n      Ctrl Seq:      ~p"
 1389:        "~n      Ctrl interval: ~p"
 1390:        "~n      Lookup delay:  ~p"
 1391:        "~n      Lookup count:  ~p"
 1392:        "~n      Lookup procs:  ~p", [Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N]),
 1393:     {ok, Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1394:     {ok, _}        = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1395:     Hosts          =
 1396:         [Hostname|[H || {_,H} <- get_hosts(Config)]
 1397:          ++[H++D || H <- ["www.","www1.","www2.",""],
 1398:         	    D <- ["erlang.org","erlang.se"]]
 1399:          ++[H++"cslab.ericsson.net" || H <- ["morgoth.","hades.","styx."]]],
 1400:     ?P("ctrl-1: Hosts: "
 1401:        "~n   ~p", [Hosts]),
 1402:     %% Spawn some processes to do parallel lookups while
 1403:     %% I repeatedly do inet_gethost_native:control/1.
 1404:     TrapExit = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1405:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1406:     erlang:display(first_intermission),
 1407:     ?P("ctrl-1: First intermission: "
 1408:        "~n   Now starting control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1409:     gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1410:     erlang:display(second_intermission),
 1411:     ?P("ctrl-1: Second intermission: "
 1412:        "~n   Now stopping control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1413:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1414:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, TrapExit),
 1415:     ?P("control-1: done"),
 1416:     ok.
 1417: 
 1418: gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts) ->
 1419:     Tag       = make_ref(),
 1420:     Parent    = self(),
 1421:     Lookup    = fun() ->
 1422:                         ?P("lookuper starting"),
 1423:                         lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) 
 1424:                 end,
 1425:     Lookupers = [spawn_link(Lookup) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1426:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq),
 1427:     gethostnative_control_3(Tag, ok).
 1428: 
 1429: gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Reason) ->
 1430:     receive
 1431: 	{Tag, Lookuper, Error} ->
 1432:             ?P("control-3: received lookup error from ~p: ~p",
 1433:                [Lookuper, Error]),
 1434: 	    gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Error)
 1435:     after 0 ->
 1436:             ?P("control-3: no (more) lookup errors"),
 1437: 	    Reason
 1438:     end.
 1439: 
 1440: control_loop([], _Interval, _Tag, [], _Seq) ->
 1441:     ok;
 1442: control_loop([], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1443:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq);
 1444: control_loop([Op|Ops], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1445:     control_loop(Ops, Interval, Tag, 
 1446: 		 control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers),
 1447: 		 Seq).
 1448: 
 1449: control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers) ->
 1450:     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: await lookuper exit"),
 1451:     receive
 1452:         {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _, _}} ->
 1453:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1454:                "timetrap timeout while ~w lookupers remaining: "
 1455:                "~n   Op:       ~p"
 1456:                "~n   Interval: ~p"
 1457:                "~n   Tag:      ~p",
 1458:                [length(Lookupers), Op, Interval, Tag]),
 1459:             if
 1460:                 (Op =/= undefined) ->
 1461:                     exit({timetrap, {Op, Tag, length(Lookupers)}});
 1462:                 true ->
 1463:                     exit({timetrap, {Tag, length(Lookupers)}})
 1464:             end;
 1465: 
 1466: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1467: 	    case Reason of
 1468: 		Tag -> % Done
 1469:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1470:                        "received expected exit from lookuper ~p", [Pid]),
 1471: 		    control_loop_1
 1472: 		      (Op, Interval, Tag,
 1473: 		       lists:delete(Pid, Lookupers));
 1474: 		_ ->
 1475:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1476:                        "received unexpected exit from ~p: "
 1477:                        "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1478: 		    ct:fail(?F("Unexpected exit from ~p", [Pid]))
 1479: 	    end
 1480: 
 1481:     after Interval ->
 1482:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1483:                "timeout => (maybe) attempt control ~p when"
 1484:                "~n   Lookupers: ~p", [Op, Lookupers]),
 1485: 	    if Op =/= undefined ->
 1486: 		    ok = inet_gethost_native:control(Op);
 1487: 	       true ->
 1488: 		    ok
 1489: 	    end,
 1490: 	    Lookupers
 1491:     end.
 1492: 
 1493: lookup_loop(_, _Delay, Tag, _Parent,  0, _Hosts) ->
 1494:     ?P("lookup-loop: done with ~p", [Tag]),
 1495:     exit(Tag);
 1496: lookup_loop([], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1497:     ?P("lookup-loop: begin lookup (~p) again when count = ~p", [Tag, Cnt]),
 1498:     lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts);
 1499: lookup_loop([H|Hs], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1500:     ?P("lookup-loop: try lookup (~p, ~p) ~p", [Tag, Cnt, H]),
 1501:     case inet:gethostbyname(H) of
 1502: 	{ok, _Hent} ->
 1503:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => found"),
 1504:             ok;
 1505: 	{error, nxdomain} ->
 1506:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => nxdomain"),
 1507:             ok;
 1508: 	Error ->
 1509: 	    ?P("loopkup-loop: lookup => error for ~p: ~p", [H, Error]),
 1510: 	    Parent ! {Tag, self(), Error}
 1511:     end,
 1512:     receive
 1513:     after rand:uniform(Delay) ->
 1514: 	    lookup_loop(Hs, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt-1, Hosts) 
 1515:     end.
 1516: 
 1517: 
 1518: 
 1519: %% Test lookup with erroneously configured lookup option (OTP-12133).
 1520: lookup_bad_search_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1521:     %% Manipulation of resolver config is done in init_per_testcase
 1522:     %% and end_per_testcase to ensure cleanup.
 1523:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1524:     {ok,_Hent} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname), % Will hang loop for this bug
 1525:     ok.
 1526: 
 1527: 
 1528: 
 1529: %% Tests basic functionality of getiflist, getif, and ifget.
 1530: getif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1531:     case os:type() of
 1532: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1533: 	    do_getif(Osname);
 1534: 	{_,_} ->
 1535: 	    {skip,"inet:getif/0 probably not supported"}
 1536:     end.
 1537: 
 1538: do_getif(Osname) ->
 1539:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1540:     {ok,Address} = inet:getaddr(Hostname, inet),
 1541:     {ok,Loopback} = inet:getaddr("localhost", inet),
 1542:     {ok,Interfaces} = inet:getiflist(),
 1543:     HWAs =
 1544: 	lists:sort(
 1545: 	  lists:foldl(
 1546: 	    fun (I, Acc) ->
 1547: 		    case inet:ifget(I, [hwaddr]) of
 1548: 			{ok,[{hwaddr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1549: 			{ok,[]} -> Acc
 1550: 		    end
 1551: 	    end, [], Interfaces)),
 1552:     io:format("HWAs = ~p~n", [HWAs]),
 1553:     (Osname =/= sunos)
 1554: 	andalso ((length(HWAs) > 0) orelse (ct:fail(no_HWAs))),
 1555:     Addresses =
 1556: 	lists:sort(
 1557: 	  lists:foldl(
 1558: 	    fun (I, Acc) ->
 1559: 		    case inet:ifget(I, [addr]) of
 1560: 			{ok,[{addr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1561: 			{ok,[]} -> Acc
 1562: 		    end
 1563: 	    end, [], Interfaces)),
 1564:     {ok,Getif} = inet:getif(),
 1565:     Addresses = lists:sort([A || {A,_,_} <- Getif]),
 1566:     true = ip_member(Address, Addresses),
 1567:     true = ip_member(Loopback, Addresses),
 1568:     ok.
 1569: 
 1570: %% Test long interface names do not overrun buffer.
 1571: getif_ifr_name_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1572:     case os:type() of
 1573: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1574: 	    do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(Osname);
 1575: 	{_,_} ->
 1576: 	    {skip,"inet:ifget/2 probably not supported"}
 1577:     end.
 1578: 
 1579: do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(_) ->
 1580:     %% emulator should not crash
 1581:     {ok,[]} = inet:ifget(lists:duplicate(128, "x"), [addr]),
 1582:     ok.
 1583: 
 1584: %% Test long service names do not overrun buffer.
 1585: getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1586:     %% emulator should not crash
 1587:     {error,einval} = inet:getservbyname(list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))), tcp),
 1588:     ok.
 1589: 
 1590: %% Test inet:gifaddrs/0.
 1591: getifaddrs(Config) when is_list (Config) ->
 1592:     {ok,IfAddrs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1593:     io:format("IfAddrs = ~p.~n", [IfAddrs]),
 1594:     case [If || {If,Opts} <- IfAddrs, lists:keymember(hwaddr, 1, Opts)] of
 1595:         [] ->
 1596:             case os:type() of
 1597:                 {unix,sunos} -> ok;
 1598:                 OT ->
 1599:                     ct:fail({should_have_hwaddr,OT})
 1600:             end;
 1601:         [_|_] -> ok
 1602:     end,
 1603:     Addrs = ifaddrs(IfAddrs),
 1604:     io:format("Addrs = ~p.~n", [Addrs]),
 1605:     [check_addr(Addr) || Addr <- Addrs],
 1606:     ok.
 1607: 
 1608: check_addr(Addr)
 1609:   when tuple_size(Addr) =:= 8,
 1610:        element(1, Addr) band 16#FFC0 =:= 16#FE80 ->
 1611:     io:format("Addr: ~p link local; SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1612:     ok;
 1613: check_addr(Addr) ->
 1614:     io:format("Addr: ~p.~n", [Addr]),
 1615:     Ping = "ping",
 1616:     Pong = "pong",
 1617:     {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip,Addr},{active,false}]),
 1618:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 1619:     {ok,S1} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, P, [{active,false}]),
 1620:     {ok,S2} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1621:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S2, Ping),
 1622:     {ok,Ping} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, length(Ping)),
 1623:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S1, Pong),
 1624:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 1625:     {ok,Pong} = gen_tcp:recv(S2, length(Pong)),
 1626:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S2),
 1627:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1628: 
 1629: ifaddrs(IfOpts) ->
 1630:     IfMap = collect_ifopts(IfOpts),
 1631:     ChkFun =
 1632:         fun Self({{_,Flags} = Key, Opts}, ok) ->
 1633:                 Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
 1634:                 P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
 1635:                 case Opts of
 1636:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{broadaddr,_}|Os]
 1637:                       when Broadcast ->
 1638:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1639:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{dstaddr,_}|Os]
 1640:                       when P2P ->
 1641:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1642:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_}|Os] ->
 1643:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1644:                     [{hwaddr,_}|Os] ->
 1645:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1646:                     [] ->
 1647:                         ok
 1648:                 end
 1649:         end,
 1650:     fold_ifopts(ChkFun, ok, IfMap),
 1651:     AddrsFun =
 1652:         fun ({{_,Flags}, Opts}, Acc) ->
 1653:                 case
 1654:                     lists:member(running, Flags)
 1655:                     andalso (not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags))
 1656:                 of
 1657:                     true ->
 1658:                         lists:reverse(
 1659:                           [Addr || {addr,Addr} <- Opts],
 1660:                           Acc);
 1661:                     false ->
 1662:                         Acc
 1663:                 end
 1664:         end,
 1665:     fold_ifopts(AddrsFun, [], IfMap).
 1666: 
 1667: collect_ifopts(IfOpts) ->
 1668:     collect_ifopts(IfOpts, #{}).
 1669: %%
 1670: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap) ->
 1671:     case IfOpts of
 1672:         [{If,[{flags,Flags}|Opts]}|IfOs] ->
 1673:             Key = {If,Flags},
 1674:             case maps:is_key(Key, IfMap) of
 1675:                 true ->
 1676:                     ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap});
 1677:                 false ->
 1678:                     collect_ifopts(IfOs, IfMap, Opts, Key, [])
 1679:             end;
 1680:         [] ->
 1681:             IfMap;
 1682:         _ ->
 1683:             ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap})
 1684:     end.
 1685: %%
 1686: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Opts, Key, R) ->
 1687:     case Opts of
 1688:         [{flags,_}|_] ->
 1689:             {If,_} = Key,
 1690:             collect_ifopts(
 1691:               [{If,Opts}|IfOpts], maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap));
 1692:         [OptVal|Os] ->
 1693:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Os, Key, [OptVal|R]);
 1694:         [] ->
 1695:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap))
 1696:     end.
 1697: 
 1698: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap) ->
 1699:     fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, maps:keys(IfMap)).
 1700: %%
 1701: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, Keys) ->
 1702:     case Keys of
 1703:         [Key|Ks] ->
 1704:             Opts = maps:get(Key, IfMap),
 1705:             fold_ifopts(Fun, Fun({Key,Opts}, Acc), IfMap, Ks);
 1706:         [] ->
 1707:             Acc
 1708:     end.
 1709: 
 1710: %% Works just like lists:member/2, except that any {127,_,_,_} tuple
 1711: %% matches any other {127,_,_,_}. We do this to handle Linux systems
 1712: %% that use (for instance) 127.0.1.1 as the IP address for the hostname.
 1713: 
 1714: ip_member({127,_,_,_}, [{127,_,_,_}|_]) -> true;
 1715: ip_member(K, [K|_]) -> true;
 1716: ip_member(K, [_|T]) -> ip_member(K, T);
 1717: ip_member(_, []) -> false.
 1718: 
 1719: %% Case fold to upper case according to RFC 4343
 1720: %%
 1721: toupper([C|Cs]) when is_integer(C) ->
 1722:     if  $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 1723: 	    [(C - $a + $A)|toupper(Cs)];
 1724: 	true ->
 1725: 	    [C|toupper(Cs)]
 1726:     end;
 1727: toupper([]) ->
 1728:     [].
 1729: 
 1730: 
 1731: simple_netns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1732:     {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 1733:     case inet:setopts(U, [{netns,""}]) of
 1734: 	ok ->
 1735: 	    jog_netns_opt(U),
 1736: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 1737: 	    %%
 1738: 	    {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 1739: 	    jog_netns_opt(L),
 1740: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 1741: 	    %%
 1742: 	    case gen_sctp:open() of
 1743: 		{ok,S} ->
 1744: 		    jog_netns_opt(S),
 1745: 		    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 1746: 		{error,eprotonosupport} ->
 1747: 		    ok
 1748: 	    end;
 1749: 	{error,einval} ->
 1750: 	    {skip,"setns() not supported"}
 1751:     end.
 1752: 
 1753: jog_netns_opt(S) ->
 1754:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 1755:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,""}]),
 1756:     {ok,[{netns,""}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 1757:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]),
 1758:     {ok,[{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: 
 1762: %% Smoke test netns support.
 1763: simple_netns_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1764:     %% Note: {error,enoent} will be returned if the run-time executable
 1765:     %%       has support for netns, but /proc/self/ns/net is missing.
 1766:     case gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 1767: 	{ok,U} ->
 1768: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U);
 1769: 	{error,E1} when E1 =:= einval; E1 =:= eperm; E1 =:= enoent ->
 1770: 	    ok
 1771:     end,
 1772:     case gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 1773: 	{ok,T} ->
 1774: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(T);
 1775: 	{error,E2} when E2 =:= einval; E2 =:= eperm; E2 =:= enoent ->
 1776: 	    ok
 1777:     end,
 1778:     try gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 1779: 	{ok,S} ->
 1780: 	    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 1781: 	{error,E3}
 1782: 	  when E3 =:= einval; E3 =:= eperm;
 1783: 	       E3 =:= enoent; E3 =:= eprotonosupport ->
 1784: 	    ok
 1785:     catch
 1786: 	error:badarg ->
 1787: 	    %% Some older platforms does not allow netns for sctp
 1788: 	    ok
 1789:     end.
 1790: 
 1791: 
 1792: %% Manual test to be run outside test_server in an emulator
 1793: %% started by root, in a machine with setns() support...
 1794: test_netns() ->
 1795:     DefaultIF = v1,
 1796:     DefaultIP = {192,168,1,17},
 1797:     Namespace = "test",
 1798:     NamespaceIF = v2,
 1799:     NamespaceIP = {192,168,1,18},
 1800:     %%
 1801:     DefaultIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(DefaultIP),
 1802:     NamespaceIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(NamespaceIP),
 1803:     cmd("ip netns add ~s",
 1804: 	[Namespace]),
 1805:     cmd("ip link add name ~w type veth peer name ~w netns ~s",
 1806:         [DefaultIF,NamespaceIF,Namespace]),
 1807:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 1808: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIPString,NamespaceIF]),
 1809:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip link set ~w up",
 1810: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIF]),
 1811:     cmd("ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 1812: 	[DefaultIPString,DefaultIF]),
 1813:     cmd("ip link set ~w up",
 1814: 	[DefaultIF]),
 1815:     try test_netns(
 1816: 	  {DefaultIF,DefaultIP},
 1817: 	  filename:join("/var/run/netns/", Namespace),
 1818: 	  {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) of
 1819: 	Result ->
 1820: 	    io:put_chars(["#### Test done",io_lib:nl()]),
 1821: 	    Result
 1822:     after
 1823: 	cmd("ip link delete ~w type veth",
 1824: 	    [DefaultIF]),
 1825: 	cmd("ip netns delete ~s",
 1826: 	    [Namespace])
 1827:     end.
 1828: 
 1829: test_netns({DefaultIF,DefaultIP}, Namespace, {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) ->
 1830:     {ok,ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1831:     {ok,[{addr,DefaultIP}]} = inet:ifget(ListenSocket, DefaultIF, [addr]),
 1832:     {ok,ListenPort} = inet:port(ListenSocket),
 1833:     {ok,ConnectSocket} =
 1834: 	gen_tcp:connect(
 1835: 	  DefaultIP, ListenPort, [{active,false},{netns,Namespace}], 3000),
 1836:     {ok,[{addr,NamespaceIP}]} = inet:ifget(ConnectSocket, NamespaceIF, [addr]),
 1837:     {ok,ConnectPort} = inet:port(ConnectSocket),
 1838:     {ok,AcceptSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket, 0),
 1839:     {ok,AcceptPort} = inet:port(AcceptSocket),
 1840:     {ok,{NamespaceIP,ConnectPort}} = inet:peername(AcceptSocket),
 1841:     {ok,{DefaultIP,AcceptPort}} = inet:peername(ConnectSocket),
 1842:     ok = gen_tcp:send(ConnectSocket, "data"),
 1843:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ConnectSocket),
 1844:     {ok,"data"} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 4, 1000),
 1845:     {error,closed} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 1, 1000),
 1846:     ok = gen_tcp:close(AcceptSocket),
 1847:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket).
 1848: 
 1849: cmd(Cmd, Args) ->
 1850:     cmd(io_lib:format(Cmd, Args)).
 1851: %%
 1852: cmd(CmdString) ->
 1853:     io:put_chars(["# ",CmdString,io_lib:nl()]),
 1854:     io:put_chars([os:cmd(CmdString++" ; echo '  =>' $?")]),
 1855:     ok.
 1856: 
 1857: -define(CAP_NET_RAW, 13).        %% from /usr/include/linux/capability.h
 1858: 
 1859: can_bind_to_device({unix, linux}, {Major, _, _})
 1860:   when Major > 2 ->
 1861:     Status = os:cmd("cat /proc/self/status | grep CapEff"),
 1862:     [_, CapEffStr] = string:tokens(Status, [$\n, $\t]),
 1863:     CapEff = list_to_integer(CapEffStr, 16),
 1864:     if CapEff band (1 bsl ?CAP_NET_RAW) =/= 0 ->
 1865:             ok;
 1866:        true ->
 1867:             {skip,"insufficient capabilities, CAP_NET_RAW not granted"}
 1868:     end;
 1869: can_bind_to_device(_OS, _Version) ->
 1870:     {skip,"socket option bind_to_device not supported on this OS or version"}.
 1871: 
 1872: simple_bind_to_device(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1873:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 1874:         ok ->
 1875:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 1876:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(U),
 1877:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 1878:             %%
 1879:             {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 1880:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(L),
 1881:             ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 1882:             %%
 1883:             case gen_sctp:open() of
 1884:                 {ok,S} ->
 1885:                     jog_bind_to_device_opt(S),
 1886:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 1887:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 1888:                     ok
 1889:             end;
 1890:         Other ->
 1891:             Other
 1892:     end.
 1893: 
 1894: %% Smoke test bind_to_device support.
 1895: simple_bind_to_device_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1896:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 1897:         ok ->
 1898:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 1899:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 1900:             {ok,T} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 1901:             ok = gen_tcp:close(T),
 1902: 
 1903:             case gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]) of
 1904:                 {ok,S} ->
 1905:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 1906:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 1907:                     ok
 1908:             end;
 1909:         Other ->
 1910:             Other
 1911:     end.
 1912: 
 1913: jog_bind_to_device_opt(S) ->
 1914:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 1915:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<>>}]),
 1916:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<>>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 1917:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]),
 1918:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 1919:     ok.
 1920: 
 1921: add_del_host(_Config) ->
 1922:     Name = "foo.com",
 1923:     Alias = "bar.org",
 1924:     Ip = {69,89,31,226},
 1925:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 1926:         h_name = Name,
 1927:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 1928:         h_addrtype = inet,
 1929:         h_length = 4,
 1930:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 1931:     },
 1932:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 1933:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 1934:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 1935:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 1936:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 1937:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 1938:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 1939:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 1940:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet).
 1941: 
 1942: add_del_host_v6(_Config) ->
 1943:     Name = "foo.com",
 1944:     Alias = "bar.org",
 1945:     Ip = {32,1,219,8,10,11,18,240},
 1946:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 1947:         h_name = Name,
 1948:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 1949:         h_addrtype = inet6,
 1950:         h_length = 16,
 1951:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 1952:     },
 1953:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 1954:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 1955:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 1956:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 1957:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 1958:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 1959:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 1960:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 1961:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6).
 1962: 
 1963: 
 1964: 
 1965: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1966: 
 1967: %%% This is a supremely simple test case.
 1968: %%% It basically just tests that the function (inet:socknames/1,2)
 1969: %%% returns with the expected result (a list of addresses, which in
 1970: %%% the case of tcp and udp should be exactly one address long).
 1971: 
 1972: socknames_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1973:     %%% ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_socknames_sctp(Config) end).
 1974:     {skip, not_implemented_yet}.
 1975: 
 1976: 
 1977: socknames_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1978:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1979:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1980:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1981:                             Addr;
 1982:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1983:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1984:                     end
 1985:            end,
 1986:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_tcp0(Config, Addr) end,
 1987:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1988:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1989: 
 1990: do_socknames_tcp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 1991:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 1992:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 1993:     do_socknames_tcp1([], Addr),
 1994: 
 1995:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 1996:     try socket:info() of
 1997:         #{} ->
 1998:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 1999:             do_socknames_tcp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2000:     catch
 2001:         error:notsup ->
 2002:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2003:             ok;
 2004:         error:undef:ST ->
 2005:             case ST of
 2006:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2007:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2008:             end
 2009:     end.
 2010: 
 2011: 
 2012: do_socknames_tcp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2013:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2014:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2015:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2016: 
 2017:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 2018:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:listen(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2019:     ?P("try get socknames for (listen) socket: "
 2020:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2021:     PortNumber1 = case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2022: 		      {ok, [{_Addr1, PortNo1}]} ->
 2023: 			  PortNo1;
 2024: 		      {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2025:                           ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2026:                              "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2027: 			  exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2028: 		      {error, Reason1} ->
 2029:                           ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2030:                              "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2031: 			  exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2032: 		  end,
 2033:     ?P("try connect to listen socket on port ~p", [PortNumber1]),
 2034:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNumber1, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2035:     ?P("try get socknames for (connected) socket: "
 2036:        "~n      ~p", [S2]),
 2037:     case inet:socknames(S2) of
 2038: 	{ok, [_Addr2]} ->
 2039: 	    ok;
 2040: 	{ok, Addrs2} ->
 2041:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2042:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs2]),
 2043: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs2)});
 2044: 	{error, Reason2} ->
 2045:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2046:                "~n      ~p", [Reason2]),
 2047: 	    exit({skip, {connected_socket, Reason2}})
 2048:     end,
 2049:     ?P("try accept connection"),
 2050:     {ok, S3} = gen_tcp:accept(S1),
 2051:     ?P("try get socknames for (accepted) socket: "
 2052:        "~n      ~p", [S3]),
 2053:     case inet:socknames(S3) of
 2054: 	{ok, [_Addr3]} ->
 2055: 	    ok;
 2056: 	{ok, Addrs3} ->
 2057:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2058:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs3]),
 2059: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs3)});
 2060: 	{error, Reason3} ->
 2061:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2062:                "~n      ~p", [Reason3]),
 2063: 	    exit({skip, {accepted_socket, Reason3}})
 2064:     end,
 2065:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2066:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S3)),
 2067:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S2)),
 2068:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S1)),
 2069:     ?P("done"),
 2070:     ok.
 2071: 
 2072: 
 2073: socknames_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2074:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2075:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2076:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2077:                             Addr;
 2078:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2079:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2080:                     end
 2081:            end,
 2082:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_udp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2083:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2084:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2085: 
 2086: do_socknames_udp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2087:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2088:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2089:     do_socknames_udp1([], Addr),
 2090: 
 2091:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2092:     try socket:info() of
 2093:         #{} ->
 2094:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2095:             do_socknames_udp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2096:     catch
 2097:         error : notsup ->
 2098:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2099:             ok;
 2100:         error:undef:ST ->
 2101:             case ST of
 2102:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2103:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2104:             end
 2105:     end.
 2106: 
 2107: 
 2108: do_socknames_udp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2109:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2110:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2111:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2112: 
 2113:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2114:     {ok, S1} = gen_udp:open(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2115:     ?P("try get socknames for socket: "
 2116:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2117:     case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2118:         {ok, [_Addr1]} ->
 2119:             ok;
 2120:         {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2121:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2122:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2123:             exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2124:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2125:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2126:                "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2127:             exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2128:     end,
 2129:     ?P("enable debug"),
 2130:     inet:setopts(S1, [{debug, true}]),
 2131:     ?P("close socket"),
 2132:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 2133:     ?P("done"),
 2134:     ok.
 2135: 
 2136:

 2139: 
 2140: links() ->
 2141:     pi(links).
 2142: 
 2143: monitors() ->
 2144:     pi(monitors).
 2145: 
 2146: pi(Item) ->
 2147:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 2148:     Val.
 2149:     
 2150:
